Structs/DiagnosticLog.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.name: userDeviceInfo
Structs/DiagnosticLog.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.abstract: The details of the device that is being used like the OS version of the phone, model number, etc.

Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.name: timestamp
Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.abstract: The time at which the some tried to access the BluPOINT device

Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.name: accessStatus
Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.abstract: The status of the access to the BluPOINT device

Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.name: cardID
Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.abstract: The card ID which accessed the BluPOINT device

Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.name: keySetID
Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.abstract: The keySetID used to access the BluPOINT device

Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.name: macAddress
Structs/AccessLogItem.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.abstract: The MAC address of the BluPOINT device

Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.name: accessToken
Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.abstract: Session token from the BluSKY server fro the API calls.

Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.name: expiresIn
Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.abstract: The duration in which the token expires.

Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.name: userName
Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.abstract: The username which was used by the user at the time of login

Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.name: issued
Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.abstract: The time at which the token was issues in date-time format.

Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.name: expires
Structs/UserData.html#/s:8BluIDSDK8UserD.abstract: The time at which the token expired in date-time format.

Structs/UserData.html.name: UserData
Structs/UserData.html.abstract: Response data for login function.This structure is the response data for login function. It provides details like access token , duration within which the access token is valid , type of the access token, username, time at which the token was issued,

Structs/UserCredentials.html.name: UserCredentials
Structs/UserCredentials.html.abstract: This sturcture is used for logging in different BluIDSDK environments.

Structs/AccessLogItem.html.name: AccessLogItem
Structs/AccessLogItem.html.abstract: Logs of when someone tried to get access. This sturcture is used for defining details about the access logs like the time at which it was generated, whether the access was granted or not, cardID and keySetID used to access the BluPOINT device.

Structs/Device_LED.html.name: Device_LED
Structs/Device_LED.html.abstract: It is a structure that defines the colour of the LED and the duration for which it should glow.f

Structs/DiagnosticLog.html.name: DiagnosticLog
Structs/DiagnosticLog.html.abstract: Contains information like connected devices etc. and basic mobile phone information.

Enums/AllowAccessType.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.name: foreground
Enums/AllowAccessType.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.abstract: Access allowed only when application is in foreground.

Enums/AllowAccessType.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.name: phoneUnlocked
Enums/AllowAccessType.html#/s:8BluIDSDK1.abstract: Access allowed only when phone is unlocked.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: invalidInput
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The input entered by the user is not valid

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: serverErrorResponse
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The server while working as a gateway to get a response needed to handle the request, got an invalid response.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: serverBadRequest(errorCode:)
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: serverUnauthorized
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The request made needs access to a restricted resource.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: deviceFailure
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The device failed to perform the operation.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: deviceCommunicationError
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: Attempted to communicate but did not get a response.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: deviceInvalidResponse
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The response given by the device is invalid.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: deviceInBluboot
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The device is currently in BluBOOT mode.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: accessDenied
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The access permission for the operation is not granted.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: downloadFailed(message:)
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The download operation for the dependent data failed.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: deleteFailed
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The delete operation for the dependent data failed.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.name: deviceAPITimeout
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html#/s:8BluIDSDK0A1.abstract: The device didn’t respond within the time limit.

Enums/AccessStatus.html#/s:8BluIDSDK12Ac.name: granted
Enums/AccessStatus.html#/s:8BluIDSDK12Ac.abstract: The access was granted to the user.

Enums/AccessStatus.html#/s:8BluIDSDK12Ac.name: denied
Enums/AccessStatus.html#/s:8BluIDSDK12Ac.abstract: The access was denied to the user.

Enums/AccessStatus.html#/s:8BluIDSDK12Ac.name: error
Enums/AccessStatus.html#/s:8BluIDSDK12Ac.abstract: An error occured while the request was being procesed.

Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:8BluIDSDK11Dev.name: idle
Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:8BluIDSDK11Dev.abstract: When device is disconnected, it is in idle state.

Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:8BluIDSDK11Dev.name: in_use
Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:8BluIDSDK11Dev.abstract: When device is connected, it is in in_use state.

Enums/DeviceMode.html.name: DeviceMode
Enums/DeviceMode.html.abstract: Used to fetch the mode of the connected BluPOINT device

Enums/DeviceState.html.name: DeviceState
Enums/DeviceState.html.abstract: It is used to define the device state.

Enums/AccessStatus.html.name: AccessStatus
Enums/AccessStatus.html.abstract: States whether the access was granted or not.

Enums/BluIDSDKError.html.name: BluIDSDKError
Enums/BluIDSDKError.html.abstract: It denotes the possible errors that can occur.

Enums/BluIDSDK_Environment.html.name: BluIDSDK_Environment
Enums/BluIDSDK_Environment.html.abstract: It defines the different BluIDSDK environments that are available on BluSKY server.

Classes/Device_Information.html#/s:8BluI.name: enhancedTapSettings
Classes/Device_Information.html#/s:8BluI.abstract: Enhanced tap settings of the BluPOINT device.

Classes/Device_Information.html#/s:8BluI.name: lastReported
Classes/Device_Information.html#/s:8BluI.abstract: Last reported item of the BluPOINT device.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: allowAccess
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: The access type as selected by the user, which can take the values foreground, unlocked, or always.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableVibrate
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: The option to select if mobile phone should vibrate after access is granted.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableTapSetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the tap operation. Tap operation is typically used when the mobile device is in close proximity to The reader (approx. 0 to 4 in). Default setting is -50 dBm. Adjust to best suit performance for each individual reader.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableTwistSetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the twist operation. Twist operation is typically used when the mobile device is in moderte proximity to the reader. Default setting is -50 dBm. Adjust to best suit performance for each individual reader.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableAppSpecificSetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the entrance opening mode specific to an opening application (for example, widget opening from mobile devices and wearables). Default setting is -74 dBm and minimum is -40 (disabled).

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableWaveSetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the wave operation. It requires a reader with a wave sensor to be enabled. Default setting is -74 dBm and minimum is -40 (disabled).

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableRangeSetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the In Range operation. In Range is typically used for hands free operation when there is a single reader in an area and it is clear that a person wants access through a door when their mobile device is within range to the reader (approx. 1 m). Default setting is -74 dBm. Adjust to best suit performance for each individual reader.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableAISetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the AI operation. AI is typically used for hands free operation when there is a single reader in an area and it is clear that a person wants access through a door based upon many factors. Default setting is -74 dBm. Adjust to best suit performance for each individual reader.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableAppleWatchSetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the Apple Watch Tap operation. Apple Watch Tap is used when the Apple Watch tapped in close proximity to the reader (approx. 1 m). Default setting is -74 dBm. Adjust to best suit performance for each individual reader.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enableBluREMOTESetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the BluREMOTE operation. BluREMOTE is typically used when the user wants to choose the door to open from a list on their mobile device. Default setting is -74 dBm. Adjust to best suit performance for each individual reader.

Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: enhancedTapSetting
Classes/UserPreferences.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: This option enables/disables the entrance tap operation. Enhanced Tap operation is typically used when the mobile device is in close proximity to the reader (approx. 0 to 4 in). Default settings are iOS Background: - 30 dBm iOS Foreground: - 30 dBm Android: - 45 dBm. Adjust to best suit performance to each individual reader.

Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html#/s:8Blu.name: enabled
Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html#/s:8Blu.abstract: If enhanced tap settings are enabled or not.

Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html#/s:8Blu.name: iosBackgroundPower
Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html#/s:8Blu.abstract: The minimum power required for enhanced tap to work when application is in background in a iOS device.

Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html#/s:8Blu.name: iosForegroundPower
Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html#/s:8Blu.abstract: The minimum power required for enhanced tap to work when application is in foreground in a iOS device.

Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html#/s:8Blu.name: androidPower
Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html#/s:8Blu.abstract: The minimum power required for enhanced tap to work in a android device.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: personCardID
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Represents the PK of the Person Card item that is assigned to an existing User.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: cardID
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Represents the PK of the Card item that is assigned to an existing User.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: cardACSystemName
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Represents the name of the Access Control system that the card belongs to.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: cardSerialNumber
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Represents the card serial number of the card, if supported (typically for smart cards).

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: externalCardNumber
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Represents the external number / hotstamp of the card that is assigned to an existing user.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: issuedBy
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Represents the system that has issued this card.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: isDeleted
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Represents whether this card has been deleted.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: activationDate
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Date and time of the card activation.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: deactivationDate
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Date and time of the card de-activation.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.name: lastUsed
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html#/s:8BluID.abstract: Date and time of the last use of the card.

Classes/Device_Firmware.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: isDownloaded
Classes/Device_Firmware.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: Shows if the firmware file has been downloaded or not.

Classes/Device_Firmware.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: releaseDate
Classes/Device_Firmware.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: Date and time of release of the firmware

Classes/Device_Firmware.html#/s:8BluIDSD.name: isObsolete
Classes/Device_Firmware.html#/s:8BluIDSD.abstract: Shows if the firmware version is obsolete or not

Classes/Device_LED_Color.html#/s:8BluIDS.name: red
Classes/Device_LED_Color.html#/s:8BluIDS.abstract: Hex value of red color to be used.

Classes/Device_LED_Color.html#/s:8BluIDS.name: green
Classes/Device_LED_Color.html#/s:8BluIDS.abstract: Hex value of green color to be used

Classes/Device_LED_Color.html#/s:8BluIDS.name: blue
Classes/Device_LED_Color.html#/s:8BluIDS.abstract: Hex value of blue color to be used.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC13g.name: getSDKVersion()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC13g.abstract: The function provides current SDK package version.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC19i.name: isBluetoothTurnedON()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC19i.abstract: This function checks and return user device’s Bluetooth Adapter power status.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC21i.name: isBluetoothAuthorized()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC21i.abstract: This function reports user’s consent, for the usage of Bluetooth adapter.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20r.name: registerDebugLogging(onLog:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20r.abstract: The function is used to fetch the debug logs.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC22u.name: unregisterDebugLogging()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC22u.abstract: The function is used to stop fetching the debug logs.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC5lo.name: login(credentials:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC5lo.abstract: This function is used for signing in user with their BluB0x credentials.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC12r.name: refreshLogin(onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC12r.abstract: refreshLogin function is used to keep the session alive for current logged in user.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18r.name: registerUserDevice(personID:firebaseToken:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18r.abstract: When user is signing-in for the first time on their device, this function needs to be invoke, so that user’s device is registered with BluSKY server. This will enable BluB0X to send important updates to the user device via notification

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC6lo.name: logout()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC6lo.abstract: This function signs off the user from the their device and erases all the user cached content from their device.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20s.name: startDeviceDiscovery(filter:onDeviceDiscovered:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20s.abstract: This function scans and returns nearby BluPOINT devices.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC31s.name: startGestureBasedAuthentication()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC31s.abstract: This function allows SDK to start auto-detection of gesture and once user performs a gesture, SDK authenticates the closest nearby BluPOINT enabled door to unlock, based on PersonCard availablity with the user.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18s.name: saveUserPreference(setting:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18s.abstract: This function update user preferences for gesture based authentication

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC17g.name: getUserPreference()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC17g.abstract: This function update user preferences for gesture based authentication.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC14i.name: identifyDevice(withLED:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC14i.abstract: This function allow user to blink LED near by BluPOINT devices

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC14i.name: identifyDevice(withBuzzerONInSeconds:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC14i.abstract: This function allow user to beep BluPONT device for given seconds

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC14i.name: identifyDevice(withBothLEDnBuzzerONInSeconds:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC14i.abstract: This function allows both blinking LED and beeping device for given seconds

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16l.name: lockDeviceAccess()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16l.abstract: The function is used to disconnect the unlocked device.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20g.name: getDeviceInformation(deviceID:callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20g.abstract: This function returns the connected BluPOINT device information like name, id, firmware version , MAC.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC24g.name: getDeviceFirmwareVersion(callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC24g.abstract: The function is used to get the firmware version of the unlocked device.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC29l.name: listAvailableFirmwareVersions(onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC29l.abstract: This function returns list of available firmware version in BluSKY Server

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC28r.name: removeFirmwareFromUserDevice(versions:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC28r.abstract: This function delete downloaded firmware from user device.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18t.name: transferCredential(deviceID:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18t.abstract: The function is used to authenticate whether the user is allowed at that BluPOINT device.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC15s.name: syncPersonCards(onComplete:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC15s.abstract: This function fetch person cards from BluSKY Server and saves it to user device.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC21g.name: getPersonCardsOffline()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC21g.abstract: This function returns all person cards available in user device.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16d.name: downloadFirmware(versions:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16d.abstract: The function is used to download a list of firmware versions from the BluSKY server.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16d.name: downloadFirmware(version:onComplete:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16d.abstract: This function downloads given firmware version from BluSKY server

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC12r.name: rebootDevice(afterSeconds:onDisconnect:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC12r.abstract: This function reboots connectd BluPOINT device after given seconds.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC28u.name: updateMultipleDeviceFirmware(deviceIDs:firmwareVersion:onUpdateComplete:progressHandler:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC28u.abstract: This function update’s multiple BluPOINT device’s firmware to a given firmware version.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC13g.name: getDeviceMode()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC13g.abstract: This function returns device mode (BluPOINT/BluBOOT) of a selected BluPOINT device

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18g.name: getBLETxPowerLevel(callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18g.abstract: This function return set BLE Tx power of BluPOINT device

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC27u.name: updateDeviceBLETxPowerLevel(strength:callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC27u.abstract: This function allow user to update BLE Tx power of BluPOINT device to the given strength

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18u.name: unlockDeviceAccess(deviceID:onResponse:onDisconnect:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18u.abstract: This function will unlock restricted access to BluPOINT device and allow user to tweak BluPOINT device settings such as, name, LED color, Tx Power, Gesture Settings etc and Upgrade device firmware.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16u.name: updateDeviceKeys(key:callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16u.abstract: The function is used to update the connected BluPOINT device keys.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC13g.name: getAccessLogs()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC13g.abstract: The function returns the rolling arraylist of access logs.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC17g.name: getDiagnosticInfo(callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC17g.abstract: The function is used to fetch the diagnostic logs.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16u.name: updateDeviceName(name:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC16u.abstract: The function is used to set the connected BluPOINT device name.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC22u.name: updateDeviceMacAddress(macAddress:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC22u.abstract: The function is used to set the connected BluPOINT device MAC value..

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18g.name: getDeviceAccessKey(onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18g.abstract: The function is used to set the connected BluPOINT device key.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20u.name: updateDeviceSettings(enhanceTapSetting:callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20u.abstract: The function is used to set range and enable or disable Enhanced Tap operation for the connected BluPOINT device .

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20u.name: updateDeviceSettings(enableWiegand:callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20u.abstract: The function is used to enable or disable the use of Wiegand protocol.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC17s.name: setDeviceReaderID(readerID:callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC17s.abstract: The function is used to set the readerID for the connected BluPOINT device.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC22s.name: setDeviceStateLEDColor(forDeviceState:color:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC22s.abstract: This function update BluPOINT LED color for different state i.e, (inUse,idle)

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC22g.name: getDeviceStateLEDColor(forDeviceState:onResponse:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC22g.abstract: This function return the BluPOINT LED color for different state i.e, (inUse,idle)

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC34d.name: deleteAllPersonCardsFromUserDevice()
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC34d.abstract: This function removes all Person Cards from user Phone.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC31d.name: deletePersonCardsFromUserDevice(cardIDs:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC31d.abstract: This function removes, list of Person Cards provided by user.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18f.name: factoryResetDevice(onComplete:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC18f.abstract: This function erase all user setting and bring device to factory setting.

Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20u.name: updateDeviceSettings(gesture:setting:callback:)
Classes/BluIDSDK.html#/s:8BluIDSDKAAC20u.abstract: The function is used to set range and enable or disable gesture operations for the connected BluPOINT device .

Classes/BluIDSDK.html.name: BluIDSDK
Classes/BluIDSDK.html.abstract: BluIDSDK class is a collection of functions needed to access the variety of BluB0X security features like scanning of nearby devies, unlocking of door, updation of firmware.

Classes.html#/s:8BluIDSDK18MobileDeviceO.name: MobileDeviceObject
Classes.html#/s:8BluIDSDK18MobileDeviceO.abstract: This class is used by registerUserDevicefunction to give the response of success or failure for user device registration in BluSKY server.

Classes/Device.html.name: Device
Classes/Device.html.abstract: This class provides the BluPOINT device name and ID.

Classes/Device_Details.html.name: Device_Details
Classes/Device_Details.html.abstract: This class provides the firmware version and MAC Address of the BluPOINT device.

Classes/ScanFilter.html.name: ScanFilter
Classes/ScanFilter.html.abstract: This class is used to define the minimum signal strength of BluPOINT device and the time period at which the scan results should be shown while scanning the nearby BluPOINT devices.

Classes/Device_LED_Color.html.name: Device_LED_Color
Classes/Device_LED_Color.html.abstract: This class is used to define different colours by setting different hex values for red, green and blue.

Classes/Device_Firmware.html.name: Device_Firmware
Classes/Device_Firmware.html.abstract: This class provides the firmware details and also the state whether it is downloaded on the given BluPOINT device.

Classes/PersonCardDetails.html.name: PersonCardDetails
Classes/PersonCardDetails.html.abstract: This class represents existing Card information that belongs to an existing User. Used during the authorization and authentication check of the user using.

Classes/MobileDeviceInfo.html.name: MobileDeviceInfo
Classes/MobileDeviceInfo.html.abstract: This class provides the information for the mobile device on which the application is installed.

Classes/GestureSetting.html.name: GestureSetting
Classes/GestureSetting.html.abstract: Class to set and get the power and if gestures are used.

Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html.name: EnhancedTapSettings
Classes/EnhancedTapSettings.html.abstract: The setting at which the user wants the mobile phone to interact with BluPOINT devices.

Classes/UserPreferences.html.name: UserPreferences
Classes/UserPreferences.html.abstract: The setting at which the user wants the mobile phone to interact with BluPOINT devices.

Classes/Device_Information.html.name: Device_Information
Classes/Device_Information.html.abstract: Used to set and get the device settings and information of BluPOINT devices.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
